section.title: Event Visualizer overview
section.para: With the Event Visualizer app, you can select events to analyse in a chart.

listitem.para: In the Apps menu, click Event Visualizer.
Select a chart type.
In the menu to the left, select the meta data you want to analyse.
Click Layout and arrange the dimensions.
You can keep the default selection if you want.
Click Update.

section.title: Select a chart type
section.para: The Event Visualizer app has eight different chart types, each with different characteristics. To select a chart type:

listitem.para: In Chart type, click the chart type you need.

entry.para: Chart type
Description
Column chart
Displays information as vertical rectangular columns with lengths proportional to the values they represent.
Useful when you want to, for example, compare performance of different districts.
Stacked column chart
Displays information as vertical rectangular columns, where bars representing multiple categories are stacked on top of each other.
Useful when you want to, for example, display trends or sums of related data elements.
Bar chart
Same as column chart, only with horizontal bars.
Stacked bar chart
Same as stacked column chart, only with horizontal bars.
Line chart
Displays information as a series of points connected by straight lines. Also referred to as time series.
Useful when you want to, for example, visualize trends in indicator data over multiple time periods.
Area chart
Is based on line chart, with the space between the axis and the line filled with colors and the lines stacked on top of each other.
Useful when you want to compare the trends of related indicators.
Pie chart
Circular chart divided into sectors (or slices).
Useful when you want to, for example, visualize the proportion of data for individual data elements compared to the total sum of all data elements in the chart.
Radar chart
Displays data on axes starting from the same point. Also known as spider chart.

listitem.para: Click Update.

section.title: Charts with aggregated values/Select dimension items
section.para: An event report is always based on a program. You can do analysis based on a range of dimensions. Each dimension can have a corresponding filter. Dimensions can be selected from the left-side menu and includes the following:

listitem.para: Data elements: Start by selecting the program and program stage for the event report. The data elements associated with the selected program will be listed under available items. Each data element acts as a dimension, and can be selected by double-clicking on it. After selecting a data element, it will be visible under "selected data items". Here you can specify a filter for each data element, with operators such as "greater than", "in" or "equal" together with a filter value.

Periods: For the period dimension you have three options: relative periods, fixed periods and start/end dates. Relative periods can e.g. be "last 12 months", and has the advantage that it keeps the data in the report up to date as time goes. Fixed periods can e.g. be "January 2014". You can switch to start/end dates by selecting from the drop-down menu under the periods tab, which lets you specify flexible dates for the time span in the report.

Organisation units: The organisation unit dimension lets you select any org unit from the hierarchy. You can use the org unit mode selector to select org units explicitly, by org unit hierarchy levels and by org unit groups.

section.para: Note that data elements of continuous value types (real numbers/decimal numbers) can only be used as filters, and will automatically be positioned as filters in the layout dialog. The reason for this is that continuous number cannot be grouped into sensible ranges and used on columns and rows.

section.title: Select series, category and filter
section.para: You can define which dimension of the data you want to appear as series, category and filter. Each data element appears as individual dimensions and can be placed on any of the axes. Series and category panels can only have one dimension at the time.

listitem.para: Click Layout.
Drag and drop the dimensions to the appropriate space. Only one dimension can be in each section.
Click Update.

section.title: Change the display of your chart
section.para: You can customize the display of an event report. The following options apply to aggregated values-type reports only:

listitem.para: Click Options.
Set the options as required.

entry.para: Displays values as numbers on top of each series.
Displays the trend line which visualizes how your data evolves over time. For example if performance is improving or deteriorating. Useful when periods are selected as category.
Hides the category items with no data from the chart.
Includes only completed events in the aggregation process. This is useful when you want for example to exclude partial events in indicator calculations.
Displays a horizontal line at the given domain value. Useful for example when you want to compare your performance to the current target.
Displays a horizontal line at the given domain value. Useful for example when you want to visualize how your performance has evolved since the beginning of a process.
Allows you to sort the values on your chart from either low to high or high to low.
Defines the output type. The output types are Event, Enrollment andTracked entity instance.
Defines the maximum and minimum value which will be visible on the range axis.
Defines the number of ticks which will be visible on the range axis.
Defines the number of decimals which will be used for range axis values.
Type a title here to display a label next to the range axis (also referred to as the Y axis). Useful when you want to give context information to the chart, for example about the unit of measure.
Type a title here to display a label below the domain axis (also referred to as the X axis). Useful when you want to give context information to the chart, for example about the period type.
Hides the legend and leaves more room for the chart itself.
Hides the title of your chart.
Type any title here to display it above the chart.

listitem.para: Click Update.

section.title: Download a chart as an image or a PDF
section.para: After you have created a chart you can download it to your local computer as an image or PDF file.

listitem.para: Click Download.
Under Graphics, click PNG (.png) or PDF (.pdf).
The file is automatically downloaded to your computer. Now you can for example embed the image file into a text document as part of a report.

section.title: Download chart data source
section.para: You can download the data source behind a chart in HTML, JSON, XML, Microsoft Excel or CSV formats. The data document uses identifiers of the dimension items and opens in a new browser window to display the URL of the request to the Web API in the address bar. This is useful for developers of apps and other client modules based on the DHIS 2 Web API or for those who require a plan data source, for instance for import into statistical packages.
To download plain data source formats:

listitem.para: Click Download.
Under Plain data source, click the format you want to download.

entry.para: Format
Action
Description
HTML
Click HTML
JSON
Click JSON
Downloads JSON format based on ID property.

Click XML
Downloads XML format based on ID property.

Click Microsoft Excel
Downloads Microsoft Excel format based on ID property.

Downloads CSV format based on ID property.

section.title: Manage chart favorites
section.para: Saving your charts as favorites makes it easy to restore them later. It also gives you the opportunity to share them with other users as an interpretation or display them on the dashboard.

section.title: Save a chart as a favorite

listitem.para: Click Favorites.
The Favorites dialog box opens.
Click Add new.
The Create new favorite dialog box opens.
In the text box, type the name you want to give your chart.
Click Create.
Click Favorites.
The Favorites dialog box opens.
Find the favorite you want to open. You can either use Prev and Next or the search field to find a saved favorite. The list is filtered on every character that you enter.
Click the name.
Click Favorites.
The Favorites dialog box opens.
Find the favorite you want to rename.
You can either use Prev and Next or the search field to find a saved favorite.
Click the grey rename icon next to the favorite's name.
The Rename favorite dialog box favorite opens.
Type the new name and click Update.

section.title: Overwrite a favorite
section.para: To save the current chart to an existing favorite (overwrite):

listitem.para: Click Favorites.
The Favorites dialog box opens.
Find the favorite you want to overwrite.
You can either use Prev and Next or the search field to find a saved favorite.
Click the green overwrite icon next to the favorite's name.
Click OK to confirm that you want to overwrite the favorite.

section.title: Share a chart interpretation
section.para: For certain analysis-related resources in DHIS 2, you can share a data interpretation. An interpretation is a link to the relevant resource together with a text expressing some insight about the data.
To create an interpretation of a chart and share it with all users of the system:

listitem.para: Open or create a favorite chart.
Click Share > Write interpretation.
The Write interpretation dialog box opens.
In the text field, type a comment, question or interpretation.
Click Share.
The dialog box closes automatically. You can see the interpretation on the Dashboard.

section.title: Modify sharing settings for a favorite
section.para: After you have created a chart and saved it as a favorite, you can share the favorite with everyone or a user group. To modify the sharing settings:

listitem.para: Click Favorites.
Find the favorite you want to share.
You can either use Prev and Next or the search field to find a saved favorite.
Click the blue share icon next to the favorite's name.
In the text box, enter the name of the user group you want to share your favorite with and click the + icon.
The chosen user group is added to the list of recipients.
Repeat the step to add more user groups.
If you want to allow external access, select the corresponding box.
For each user group, choose an access setting. The options are:
None
Can view
Can edit and view
Click Save.
Click Favorites.
The Favorites dialog box opens.
Find the favorite you want to delete.
You can either use Prev and Next or the search field to find a saved favorite.
Click the red delete icon next to the favorite's name.
Click OK to confirm that you want to delete the favorite.

section.title: Embed charts in any web page
section.para: Certain analysis-related resources in DHIS 2, like pivot tables, charts and maps, can be embedded in any web page by using a plug-in. You will find more information about the plug-ins in the Web API chapter in the DHIS2 Developer Manual.
To generate a HTML fragment that you can use to display the chart in an external web page:

listitem.para: Click Share > Embed in web page.
The Embed in web page window opens.
Click Select to highlight the HTML fragment.

section.title: Visualize a chart as a pivot table or a map
section.para: When you have made a chart you can switch between pivot table, chart and map visualization of your data.

section.title: Open a chart as a pivot table

listitem.para: Click Chart > Open this chart as table.
Your current chart opens as a pivot table.

section.title: Open a chart as a map

listitem.para: Click Chart > Open this chart as map.
Your current chart opens as a map.
